name: Eddy Grant
description:
'''Edmond Montague Grant''' (born 5 March 1948) is a [[Guyanese in the United Kingdom|Guyanese-British]] singer, songwriter, record producer, and multi-instrumentalist known for his genre-blending sound and socially conscious lyrics. In addition to this, he also created the genre of "[[ringbang]]". He was a founding member of [[the Equals]], one of the United Kingdom's first racially mixed pop groups who are best remembered for their million-selling UK chart-topper, the Grant-penned "[[Baby, Come Back (The Equals song)|Baby, Come Back]]".

His subsequent solo career included the 1982 song "[[I Don't Wanna Dance (Eddy Grant song)|I Don't Wanna Dance]]", plus the platinum 1983 single "[[Electric Avenue (song)|Electric Avenue]]", which is his biggest international hit. He earned a [[Grammy Award]] nomination for the song. He is also well known for the 1988 anti-[[apartheid]] song "[[Gimme Hope Jo'anna]]".
